   20: 
   21: -module(timer_bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([start_timer_1/1, send_after_1/1, send_after_2/1, send_after_3/1,
   26: 	 cancel_timer_1/1, cancel_timer_sync/1,
   27: 	 start_timer_big/1, send_after_big/1,
   28: 	 start_timer_e/1, send_after_e/1, cancel_timer_e/1,
   29: 	 read_timer_trivial/1, read_timer/1, read_timer_async/1,
   30: 	 cleanup/1, evil_timers/1, registered_process/1, same_time_yielding/1,
   31: 	 same_time_yielding_with_cancel/1, same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other/1,
   32: %	 same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other_accessor/1,
   33: 	 auto_cancel_yielding/1,
   34:          suspended_scheduler_timeout/1,
   35:          multizero_timeout_in_timeout/1]).
   36: 
   37: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   38: 
   39: -define(SHORT_TIMEOUT, 5000). %% Bif timers as short as this may be pre-allocated
   40: -define(TIMEOUT_YIELD_LIMIT, 100).
   41: -define(AUTO_CANCEL_YIELD_LIMIT, 100).
   42: 
   43: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   44:     case catch erts_debug:get_internal_state(available_internal_state) of
   45: 	true -> ok;
   46: 	_ -> erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true)
   47:     end,
   48:     Config.
   49: 
   50: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   51:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   52: 
   53: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   54:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   58:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false).
   59: 
   60: suite() ->
   61:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   62:      {timetrap, {minutes, 5}}].
   63: 
   64: all() -> 
   65:     [start_timer_1, send_after_1, send_after_2,
   66:      cancel_timer_1, cancel_timer_sync, start_timer_e, send_after_e,
   67:      cancel_timer_e, start_timer_big, send_after_big,
   68:      read_timer_trivial, read_timer, read_timer_async,
   69:      cleanup, evil_timers, registered_process,
   70:      same_time_yielding, same_time_yielding_with_cancel,
   71:      same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other,
   72: %     same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other_accessor,
   73:      auto_cancel_yielding,
   74:      suspended_scheduler_timeout,
   75:      multizero_timeout_in_timeout].
   76: 
   77: 
   78: %% Basic start_timer/3 functionality
   79: start_timer_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     Ref1 = erlang:start_timer(1000, self(), plopp),
   81:     ok   = get(1400, {timeout, Ref1, plopp}),
   82: 
   83:     false = erlang:read_timer(Ref1),
   84:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(Ref1),
   85:     false = erlang:read_timer(Ref1),
   86: 
   87:     Ref2  = erlang:start_timer(1000, self(), plapp),
   88:     Left2 = erlang:cancel_timer(Ref2),
   89:     UpperLimit = 1000,
   90:     true = (Left2 > 600) and (Left2 =< UpperLimit),
   91:     empty = get_msg(),
   92:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(Ref2),
   93: 
   94:     Ref3 = erlang:start_timer(1000, self(), plopp),
   95:     no_message = get(600, {timeout, Ref3, plopp}),
   96:     ok.
   97: 
   98: %% Basic send_after/3 functionality
   99: send_after_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  100:     Ref3 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), plipp),
  101:     ok = get(1500, plipp),
  102:     false = erlang:read_timer(Ref3),
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: %% Big timeouts for start_timer/3
  106: start_timer_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  107:     Big = 1 bsl 31,
  108:     R = erlang:start_timer(Big, self(), hej),
  109:     timer:sleep(200),
  110:     Left = erlang:cancel_timer(R),
  111:     case Big - Left of
  112:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  113:             ok;
  114:         _Diff ->
  115:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  116:     end,
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: %% Big timeouts for send_after/3
  120: send_after_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     Big = 1 bsl 31,
  122:     R = erlang:send_after(Big, self(), hej),
  123:     timer:sleep(200),
  124:     Left = erlang:cancel_timer(R),
  125:     case Big - Left of
  126:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  127:             ok;
  128:         _Diff ->
  129:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  130:     end,
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: %% send_after/3: messages in the right order, kind version
  134: send_after_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  135:     _ = erlang:send_after(5000, self(), last),
  136:     _ = erlang:send_after(0, self(), a0),
  137:     _ = erlang:send_after(200, self(), a2),
  138:     _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), a1),
  139:     _ = erlang:send_after(500, self(), a5),
  140:     _ = erlang:send_after(300, self(), a3),
  141:     _ = erlang:send_after(400, self(), a4),
  142:     [a0,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,last] = collect(last),
  143:     ok.
  144: 
  145: %% send_after/3: messages in the right order, worse than send_after_2
  146: send_after_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  147:     _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), b1),
  148:     _ = erlang:send_after(101, self(), b2),
  149:     _ = erlang:send_after(102, self(), b3),
  150:     _ = erlang:send_after(103, self(), last),
  151:     [b1, b2, b3, last] = collect(last),
  152: 
  153:     % This behaviour is not guaranteed:
  154:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), c1),
  155:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), c2),
  156:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), c3),
  157:     %    _ = erlang:send_after(100, self(), last),
  158:     %    [c1, c2, c3, last] = collect(last),
  159: 
  160:     ok.
  161: 
  162: %% Check trivial cancel_timer/1 behaviour
  163: cancel_timer_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(make_ref()),
  165: 
  166:     ok.
  167: 
  168: cancel_timer_sync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  169:     cancel_timer_sync_test(true),
  170:     cancel_timer_sync_test(false).
  171: 
  172: cancel_timer_sync_test(SameSched) ->
  173:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  174: 
  175:     R1 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), cling),
  176:     R2 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), clong),
  177:     R3 = erlang:send_after(1000, self(), clang),
  178:     TsSet = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  179:     R4 = erlang:send_after(0, self(), pling),
  180:     R5 = erlang:send_after(0, self(), plong),
  181:     R6 = erlang:send_after(0, self(), plang),
  182:     R7 = make_ref(),
  183:     R8 = make_ref(),
  184:     R9 = make_ref(),
  185: 
  186:     case SameSched of
  187: 	true ->
  188: 	    %% Cancel from the same scheduler...
  189: 	    ok;
  190: 	false->
  191: 	    %% Cancel from different scheduler...
  192: 	    process_flag(scheduler, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))
  193:     end,
  194: 
  195:     C1 = erlang:cancel_timer(R1),
  196:     true = is_integer(C1),
  197:     C2 = erlang:cancel_timer(R2, [{info, true}]),
  198:     true = is_integer(C2),
  199:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R3, [{info, false}]),
  200: 
  201:     receive pling -> ok end,
  202:     receive plong -> ok end,
  203:     receive plang -> ok end,
  204: 
  205:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R4),
  206:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R5, [{info, true}]),
  207:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R6, [{info, false}]),
  208:     
  209:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R7),
  210:     false = erlang:cancel_timer(R8, [{info, true}]),
  211:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R9, [{info, false}]),
  212:     
  213:     Wait = 1500 - erlang:convert_time_unit(erlang:monotonic_time() - TsSet,
  214: 					   native, millisecond),
  215: 
  216:     receive TMO when TMO == cling; TMO == clang; TMO == clong ->
  217: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timeout, TMO})
  218:     after Wait ->
  219: 	    ok
  220:     end.
  221: 
  222: %% Error cases for start_timer/3
  223: start_timer_e(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(-4, self(), hej)),
  225:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(1 bsl 64,
  226:                                             self(), hej)),
  227: 
  228:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(4.5, self(), hej)),
  229:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(a, self(), hej)),
  230: 
  231:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  232:     Pid = spawn(Node, timer, sleep, [10000]),
  233:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:start_timer(1000, Pid, hej)),
  234:     peer:stop(Peer).
  235: 
  236: %% Error cases for send_after/3
  237: send_after_e(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  238:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(-4, self(), hej)),
  239:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(1 bsl 64,
  240:                                            self(), hej)),
  241: 
  242:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(4.5, self(), hej)),
  243:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(a, self(), hej)),
  244: 
  245:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  246:     Pid = spawn(Node, timer, sleep, [10000]),
  247:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:send_after(1000, Pid, hej)),
  248:     peer:stop(Peer).
  249: 
  250: %% Error cases for cancel_timer/1
  251: cancel_timer_e(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  252:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:cancel_timer(1)),
  253:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:cancel_timer(self())),
  254:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:cancel_timer(a)),
  255:     ok.
  256: 
  257: %% Trivial and error test cases for read_timer/1.
  258: read_timer_trivial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     false = erlang:read_timer(make_ref()),
  260:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(42)),
  261:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(423497834744444444457667444444)),
  262:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(self())),
  263:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch erlang:read_timer(ab)),
  264:     ok.
  265: 
  266: %% Test that read_timer/1 seems to return the correct values.
  267: read_timer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  268:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  269:     Big = 1 bsl 31,
  270:     R = erlang:send_after(Big, self(), hej_hopp),
  271: 
  272:     receive after 200 -> ok end,		% Delay and clear reductions.
  273:     Left = erlang:read_timer(R),
  274:     Left2 = erlang:cancel_timer(R),
  275:     case Left == Left2 of
  276:         true -> ok;
  277:         false -> Left = Left2 + 1
  278:     end,
  279:     false = erlang:read_timer(R),
  280: 
  281:     case Big - Left of
  282:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  283:             ok;
  284:         _Diff ->
  285:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  286:     end,
  287:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: %% Test that read_timer/1 seems to return the correct values.
  291: read_timer_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  293:     Big = 1 bsl 33,
  294:     R = erlang:send_after(Big, self(), hej_hopp),
  295: 
  296:     %% Access from another scheduler
  297:     process_flag(scheduler, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
  298: 
  299:     receive after 200 -> ok end,		% Delay and clear reductions.
  300:     ok = erlang:read_timer(R, [{async, true}]),
  301:     ok = erlang:cancel_timer(R, [{async, true}, {info, true}]),
  302:     ok = erlang:read_timer(R, [{async, true}]),
  303: 
  304:     {read_timer, R, Left} = receive_one(),
  305:     {cancel_timer, R, Left2} = receive_one(),
  306:     case Left == Left2 of
  307:         true -> ok;
  308:         false -> Left = Left2 + 1
  309:     end,
  310:     {read_timer, R, false} = receive_one(),
  311: 
  312:     case Big - Left of
  313:         Diff when Diff >= 200, Diff < 10000 ->
  314:             ok;
  315:         _Diff ->
  316:             ct:fail({big, Big, Left})
  317:     end,
  318:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: cleanup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     Mem = mem(),
  323:     %% Timer on dead process
  324:     P1 = spawn(fun () -> ok end),
  325:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P1) end),
  326:     T1 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P1, "hej"),
  327:     T2 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P1, "hej"),
  328:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  329:     Mem = mem(),
  330:     false = erlang:read_timer(T1),
  331:     false = erlang:read_timer(T2),
  332:     Mem = mem(),
  333:     %% Process dies before timeout
  334:     P2 = spawn(fun () -> receive after (?SHORT_TIMEOUT div 10) -> ok end end),
  335:     T3 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P2, "hej"),
  336:     T4 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P2, "hej"),
  337:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  338:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T3)),
  339:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T4)),
  340:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P2) end),
  341:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  342:     false = erlang:read_timer(T3),
  343:     false = erlang:read_timer(T4),
  344:     Mem = mem(),
  345:     %% Cancel timer
  346:     P3 = spawn(fun () -> receive after ?SHORT_TIMEOUT*4 -> ok end end),
  347:     T5 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P3, "hej"),
  348:     T6 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT*2, P3, "hej"),
  349:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  350:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T5)),
  351:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T6)),
  352:     false = erlang:read_timer(T5),
  353:     false = erlang:read_timer(T6),
  354:     exit(P3, kill),
  355:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P3) end),
  356:     Mem = mem(),
  357:     %% Timeout
  358:     Ref = make_ref(),
  359:     T7 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, self(), Ref),
  360:     T8 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, self(), Ref),
  361:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  362:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T7)),
  363:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T8)),
  364:     receive {timeout, T7, Ref} -> ok end,
  365:     receive Ref -> ok end,
  366:     Mem = mem(),
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: 
  370: evil_timers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     %% Create a composite term consisting of at least:
  372:     %% * externals (remote pids, ports, and refs)
  373:     %% * large (off heap) binaries
  374:     %% * small (heap) binaries
  375:     %% * funs
  376:     %% * bignums
  377:     %% * tuples
  378:     %% * lists
  379:     %% since data of these types have to be adjusted if moved
  380:     %% in memory
  381:     Self = self(),
  382:     R1 = make_ref(),
  383:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  384:     spawn_link(Node,
  385:                fun () ->
  386:                        Self ! {R1,
  387:                                [lists:sublist(erlang:ports(), 3),
  388:                                 [make_ref(), make_ref(), make_ref()],
  389:                                 lists:sublist(processes(), 3),
  390:                                 [fun () -> gurka end,
  391:                                  fun (A) -> A + 1 end,
  392:                                  fun (A, B) -> A + B end]]}
  393:                end),
  394:     ExtList = receive {R1, L} -> L end,
  395:     peer:stop(Peer),
  396:     BinList = [<<"bla">>,
  397:                <<"blipp">>,
  398:                <<"blupp">>,
  399:                list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000000,$a)),
  400:                list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000000,$b)),
  401:                list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000000,$c))],
  402:     FunList = [fun () -> gurka end,
  403:                fun (A) -> A + 1 end,
  404:                fun (A, B) -> A + B end],
  405:     PidList = lists:sublist(processes(), 3),
  406:     PortList = lists:sublist(erlang:ports(), 3),
  407:     RefList = [make_ref(), make_ref(), make_ref()],
  408:     BigList = [111111111111, 22222222222222, 333333333333333333],
  409:     Msg = {BinList,[FunList,{RefList,ExtList,PidList,PortList,BigList}]},
  410:     %% io:format("Msg=~p~n",[Msg]),
  411: 
  412:     Prio = process_flag(priority, max),
  413:     %%
  414:     %% In the smp case there are four major cases we want to test:
  415:     %%
  416:     %% 1. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  417:     %%    where Msg is a composite term, expires, and the receivers main
  418:     %%    lock *cannot* be acquired immediately (typically when the
  419:     %%    receiver *is* running).
  420:     %%
  421:     %%    The wrap tuple ({timeout, TRef, Msg}) will in this case
  422:     %%    be allocated in the previously allocated message buffer along
  423:     %%    with Msg, i.e. the previously allocated message buffer will be
  424:     %%    reallocated and potentially moved.
  425:     TimeOutMsgs0 = evil_setup_timers(200, Self, Msg),
  426:     RecvTimeOutMsgs0 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  427:     %% 2. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  428:     %%    where Msg is an immediate term, expires, and the receivers main
  429:     %%    lock *cannot* be acquired immediately (typically when the
  430:     %%    receiver *is* running).
  431:     %%
  432:     %%    The wrap tuple will in this case be allocated in a new
  433:     %%    message buffer.
  434:     TimeOutMsgs1 = evil_setup_timers(200, Self, immediate),
  435:     RecvTimeOutMsgs1 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  436:     %% 3. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  437:     %%    where Msg is a composite term, expires, and the receivers main
  438:     %%    lock *can* be acquired immediately (typically when the receiver
  439:     %%    *is not* running).
  440:     %%
  441:     %%    The wrap tuple will in this case be allocated on the receivers
  442:     %%    heap, and Msg is passed in the previously allocated message
  443:     %%    buffer.
  444:     R2 = make_ref(),
  445:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  446:                        Self ! {R2, evil_setup_timers(200, Self, Msg)}
  447:                end),
  448:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  449:     TimeOutMsgs2 = receive {R2, TOM2} -> TOM2 end,
  450:     RecvTimeOutMsgs2 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  451:     %% 4. A timer started with erlang:start_timer(Time, Receiver, Msg),
  452:     %%    where Msg is an immediate term, expires, and the Receivers main
  453:     %%    lock *can* be acquired immediately (typically when the receiver
  454:     %%    *is not* running).
  455:     %%
  456:     %%    The wrap tuple will in this case be allocated on the receivers
  457:     %%    heap.
  458:     R3 = make_ref(),
  459:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  460:                        Self ! {R3, evil_setup_timers(200,Self,immediate)}
  461:                end),
  462:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  463:     TimeOutMsgs3 = receive {R3, TOM3} -> TOM3 end,
  464:     RecvTimeOutMsgs3 = evil_recv_timeouts(200),
  465: 
  466:     %% Garge collection will hopefully crash the emulator if something
  467:     %% is wrong...
  468:     garbage_collect(),
  469:     garbage_collect(),
  470:     garbage_collect(),
  471: 
  472:     %% Make sure we got the timeouts we expected
  473:     %%
  474:     %% Note timeouts are *not* guaranteed to be delivered in order
  475:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs0), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs0)),
  476:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs1), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs1)),
  477:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs2), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs2)),
  478:     ok = match(lists:sort(RecvTimeOutMsgs3), lists:sort(TimeOutMsgs3)),
  479: 
  480:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
  481:     ok.
  482: 
  483: evil_setup_timers(N, Receiver, Msg) ->
  484:     evil_setup_timers(0, N, Receiver, Msg, []).
  485: 
  486: evil_setup_timers(N, N, _Receiver, _Msg, TOs) ->
  487:     TOs;
  488: evil_setup_timers(N, Max, Receiver, Msg, TOs) ->
  489:     TRef = erlang:start_timer(N, Receiver, Msg),
  490:     evil_setup_timers(N+1, Max, Receiver, Msg, [{timeout,TRef,Msg}|TOs]).
  491: 
  492: 
  493: evil_recv_timeouts(M) ->
  494:     evil_recv_timeouts([], 0, M).
  495: 
  496: evil_recv_timeouts(TOs, N, N) ->
  497:     TOs;
  498: evil_recv_timeouts(TOs, N, M) ->
  499:     receive
  500:         {timeout, _, _} = TO ->
  501:             evil_recv_timeouts([TO|TOs], N+1, M)
  502:     after 0 ->
  503:               evil_recv_timeouts(TOs, N, M)
  504:     end.
  505: 
  506: registered_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  507:     Mem = mem(),
  508:     %% Cancel
  509:     T1 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, "hej"),
  510:     T2 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, "hej"),
  511:     undefined = whereis(?MODULE),
  512:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  513:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T1)),
  514:     true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(T2)),
  515:     false = erlang:read_timer(T1),
  516:     false = erlang:read_timer(T2),
  517:     Mem = mem(),
  518:     %% Timeout register after start
  519:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
  520:     T3 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref1),
  521:     T4 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref1),
  522:     undefined = whereis(?MODULE),
  523:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  524:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T3)),
  525:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T4)),
  526:     true = register(?MODULE, self()),
  527:     receive {timeout, T3, Ref1} -> ok end,
  528:     receive Ref1 -> ok end,
  529:     Mem = mem(),
  530:     %% Timeout register before start
  531:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
  532:     T5 = erlang:start_timer(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref2),
  533:     T6 = erlang:send_after(?SHORT_TIMEOUT+1, ?MODULE, Ref2),
  534:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  535:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T5)),
  536:     true = is_integer(erlang:read_timer(T6)),
  537:     receive {timeout, T5, Ref2} -> ok end,
  538:     receive Ref2 -> ok end,
  539:     Mem = mem(),
  540:     true = unregister(?MODULE),
  541:     ok.
  542: 
  543: same_time_yielding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  544:     Mem = mem(),
  545:     Ref = make_ref(),
  546:     SchdlrsOnline = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  547:     SchdlrsToUse = erlang:max(1, erlang:min(8, SchdlrsOnline) - 1),
  548:     StartTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  549:     Tmo = StartTime + 20000,
  550:     NrOfTimeouts = (?TIMEOUT_YIELD_LIMIT*3+1) * SchdlrsToUse,
  551:     NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler = NrOfTimeouts div SchdlrsToUse,
  552:     Tmrs = lists:map(fun (I) ->
  553:                              SchedulerId =
  554:                                  case SchdlrsOnline of
  555:                                      1 -> 1;
  556:                                      _ ->
  557:                                          ((I div NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler) rem SchdlrsToUse)  + 2
  558:                                  end,
  559:                              process_flag(scheduler, SchedulerId),
  560:                              erlang:start_timer(Tmo, self(), Ref, [{abs, true}]),
  561:                              SchedulerId
  562:                      end,
  563:                      lists:seq(1, NrOfTimeouts)),
  564:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  565:     AllTimersStartedTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  566:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  567:     {TimeToReceive, TimeUntilFirst} = receive_all_timeouts(length(Tmrs), Ref),
  568:     Done = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  569:     true = Done >= Tmo,
  570:     MsAfterTmo = Done - Tmo,
  571:     io:format("Done ~p ms after Tmo\nInfo: ~p\n",
  572:               [MsAfterTmo,
  573:                {'TimeToStartAllTimers', AllTimersStartedTime - StartTime,
  574:                 'TimeInReceiveUntilFirst',TimeUntilFirst,
  575:                 'TimeToReceive', TimeToReceive}]),
  576:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  577:         opt ->
  578:             true = MsAfterTmo < 200;
  579:         _ ->
  580:             true = MsAfterTmo < 1000
  581:     end,
  582:     Mem = mem(),
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: %% Read out all timeouts in receive queue order. This is efficient
  586: %% even if there are very many messages.
  587: 
  588: receive_all_timeouts(N, Ref) ->
  589:     receive_all_timeouts(N, Ref, not_set).
  590: 
  591: receive_all_timeouts(0, _Ref, {FirstTime, TimeUntilFirst}) ->
  592:     {erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) - FirstTime, TimeUntilFirst};
  593: receive_all_timeouts(N, Ref, Timings) ->
  594:     StartTime = case Timings of
  595:         not_set -> erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond);
  596:         _ -> ok
  597:     end,
  598:     receive
  599:         {timeout, _Tmr, Ref} ->
  600:             NewTimings =
  601:                 case Timings of
  602:                     not_set ->
  603:                         FirstMessageAtTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  604:                         {FirstMessageAtTime, FirstMessageAtTime - StartTime};
  605:                     _ -> Timings
  606:                 end,
  607:             receive_all_timeouts(N-1, Ref, NewTimings)
  608:     end.
  609: 
  610: same_time_yielding_with_cancel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  611:     same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(false, false).
  612: 
  613: same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(true, false).
  615: 
  616: %same_time_yielding_with_cancel_other_accessor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  617: %    same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(true, true).
  618: 
  619: do_cancel_tmrs(Tmo, Tmrs, Tester) ->
  620:     BeginCancel = erlang:convert_time_unit(Tmo,
  621:                                            millisecond,
  622:                                            microsecond) - 500,
  623:     busy_wait_until(fun () ->
  624:                             erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) >= BeginCancel
  625:                     end),
  626:     lists:foreach(fun (Tmr) ->
  627:                           erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr,
  628:                                               [{async, true},
  629:                                                {info, true}])
  630:                   end, Tmrs),
  631:     case Tester == self() of
  632:         true -> ok;
  633:         false -> forward_msgs(Tester)
  634:     end.
  635: 
  636: same_time_yielding_with_cancel_test(Other, Accessor) ->
  637:     Mem = mem(),
  638:     SchdlrsOnline = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  639:     SchdlrsToUse = erlang:max(1, erlang:min(8, SchdlrsOnline) - 1),
  640:     NrOfTimeouts = (?TIMEOUT_YIELD_LIMIT*3+1) * SchdlrsToUse,
  641:     NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler = NrOfTimeouts div SchdlrsToUse,
  642:     Tmo = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 6000,
  643:     Tester = self(),
  644:     Cancelor = case Other of
  645:                    false ->
  646:                        Tester;
  647:                    true ->
  648:                        spawn(fun () ->
  649:                                      receive
  650:                                          {timers, Tmrs} ->
  651:                                              do_cancel_tmrs(Tmo, Tmrs, Tester)
  652:                                      end
  653:                              end)
  654:                end,
  655:     Opts = case Accessor of
  656:                false -> [{abs, true}];
  657:                true -> [{accessor, Cancelor}, {abs, true}]
  658:            end,
  659:     Tmrs = lists:map(fun (I) ->
  660:                              SchedulerId =
  661:                                  case SchdlrsOnline of
  662:                                      1 -> 1;
  663:                                      _ ->
  664:                                          ((I div NrOfTimeoutsPerScheduler) rem SchdlrsToUse)  + 2
  665:                                  end,
  666:                              process_flag(scheduler, SchedulerId),
  667:                              erlang:start_timer(Tmo, self(), hej, Opts)
  668:                      end,
  669:                      lists:seq(1, NrOfTimeouts)),
  670:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  671:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  672:     case Other of
  673:         false ->
  674:             do_cancel_tmrs(Tmo, Tmrs, Tester);
  675:         true ->
  676:             Cancelor ! {timers, Tmrs}
  677:     end,
  678:     {Tmos, Cncls} = lists:foldl(fun (Tmr, {T, C}) ->
  679:                                         receive
  680:                                             {timeout, Tmr, hej} ->
  681:                                                 receive
  682:                                                     {cancel_timer, Tmr, Info} ->
  683:                                                         false = Info,
  684:                                                         {T+1, C}
  685:                                                 end;
  686:                                             {cancel_timer, Tmr, false} ->
  687:                                                 receive
  688:                                                     {timeout, Tmr, hej} ->
  689:                                                         {T+1, C}
  690:                                                 end;
  691:                                             {cancel_timer, Tmr, TimeLeft} ->
  692:                                                 true = is_integer(TimeLeft),
  693:                                                 {T, C+1}
  694:                                         end
  695:                                 end,
  696:                                 {0, 0},
  697:                                 Tmrs),
  698:     io:format("Timeouts: ~p Cancels: ~p~n", [Tmos, Cncls]),
  699:     Mem = mem(),
  700:     case Other of
  701:         true -> exit(Cancelor, bang);
  702:         false -> ok
  703:     end,
  704:     {comment,
  705:      "Timeouts: " ++ integer_to_list(Tmos) ++ " Cancels: "
  706:      ++ integer_to_list(Cncls)}.
  707: 
  708: auto_cancel_yielding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     Mem = mem(),
  710:     SchdlrsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  711:     P = spawn(fun () ->
  712:                       lists:foreach(
  713:                         fun (I) ->
  714:                                 process_flag(scheduler, (I rem SchdlrsOnln)+1),
  715:                                 erlang:start_timer((1 bsl 28)+I*10, self(), hej)
  716:                         end,
  717:                         lists:seq(1,
  718:                                   ((?AUTO_CANCEL_YIELD_LIMIT*3+1)
  719:                                    *SchdlrsOnln))),
  720:                       receive after infinity -> ok end
  721:               end),
  722:     true = mem_larger_than(Mem),
  723:     exit(P, bang),
  724:     wait_until(fun () -> process_is_cleaned_up(P) end),
  725:     Mem = mem(),
  726:     ok.
  727: 
  728: suspended_scheduler_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  729:     Ref = make_ref(),
  730:     SchdlrsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  731:     lists:foreach(fun (Sched) ->
  732:                           process_flag(scheduler, Sched),
  733:                           erlang:send_after(1000, self(), {Ref, Sched})
  734:                   end,
  735:                   lists:seq(1, SchdlrsOnln)),
  736:     process_flag(scheduler, 0),
  737:     erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
  738:     try
  739:         lists:foreach(fun (Sched) ->
  740:                               receive
  741:                                   {Ref, Sched} ->
  742:                                       ok
  743:                               after 2000 ->
  744:                                       ct:fail({missing_timeout, Sched})
  745:                               end
  746:                       end,
  747:                       lists:seq(1, SchdlrsOnln))
  748:     after
  749:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SchdlrsOnln)
  750:     end,
  751:     ok.
  752: 
  753: multizero_timeout_in_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  754:     Timeout = 500,
  755:     MaxTimeoutDiff = 1000,
  756: 
  757:     %% We want to operate on the same timer wheel all the time...
  758:     process_flag(scheduler, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
  759: 
  760:     erlang:send_after(5*(Timeout+MaxTimeoutDiff), self(), pling),
  761:     erlang:yield(),
  762:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  763:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(multizero_timeout_in_timeout, Timeout),
  764:     receive multizero_timeout_in_timeout_done -> ok end,
  765:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  766:     Time = erlang:convert_time_unit(End-Start, native, millisecond),
  767:     io:format("Time=~p~n", [Time]),
  768:     true = Time < Timeout + MaxTimeoutDiff,
  769:     ok.
  770:             
  771:         
  772: 
  773: process_is_cleaned_up(P) when is_pid(P) ->
  774:     undefined == erts_debug:get_internal_state({process_status, P}).
  775: 
  776: wait_until(Pred) when is_function(Pred) ->
  777:     case catch Pred() of
  778:         true -> ok;
  779:         _ -> receive after 50 -> ok end, wait_until(Pred)
  780:     end.
  781: 
  782: busy_wait_until(Pred) when is_function(Pred) ->
  783:     case catch Pred() of
  784:         true -> ok;
  785:         _ -> busy_wait_until(Pred)
  786:     end.
  787: 
  788: forward_msgs(To) ->
  789:     receive
  790:         Msg ->
  791:             To ! Msg
  792:     end,
  793:     forward_msgs(To).
  794: 
  795: get(Time, Msg) ->
  796:     receive 
  797:         Msg ->
  798:             ok
  799:     after Time
  800:           ->
  801:               no_message
  802:     end.
  803: 
  804: get_msg() ->
  805:     receive
  806:         Msg ->
  807:             {ok, Msg}
  808:     after 0 ->
  809:               empty
  810:     end.
  811: 
  812: collect(Last) ->
  813:     collect(Last, []).
  814: 
  815: receive_one() ->
  816:     receive
  817:         Msg ->
  818:             Msg
  819:     end.
  820: 
  821: collect(Last, Msgs0) ->
  822:     Msg = receive_one(),
  823:     Msgs = Msgs0 ++ [Msg],
  824:     case Msg of
  825:         Last ->
  826:             Msgs;
  827:         _ ->
  828:             collect(Last, Msgs)
  829:     end.
  830: 
  831: match(X, X) ->
  832:     %erlang:display({match, X}),
  833:     ok;
  834: match(X, Y) ->
  835:     %erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  836:     match_aux(X, Y).
  837: 
  838: match_aux(X, X) ->
  839:     unexpected_error;
  840: match_aux(X, Y) when is_list(X), is_list(Y), length(X) =/= length(Y) ->
  841:     %% erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  842:     {list_length_mismatch, length(X), length(Y)};
  843: match_aux([X|Xs], [X|Ys]) ->
  844:     match_aux(Xs, Ys);
  845: match_aux([X|_], [Y|_]) ->
  846:     match_aux(X, Y);
  847: match_aux(X, Y) when is_tuple(X), is_tuple(Y), size(X) =/= size(Y) ->
  848:     %% erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  849:     {tuple_size_mismatch, size(X), size(Y)};
  850: match_aux(X, Y) when is_tuple(X), is_tuple(Y) ->
  851:     match_aux(tuple_to_list(X), tuple_to_list(Y));
  852: match_aux(X, Y) ->
  853:     %% erlang:display({mismatch, X, Y}),
  854:     {mismatch, type(X), type(Y)}.
  855: 
  856: type(X) when is_list(X) -> list;
  857: type(X) when is_tuple(X) -> tuple;
  858: type(X) when is_float(X) -> float;
  859: type(X) when is_integer(X) -> integer;
  860: type(X) when is_pid(X) -> {pid, node(X)};
  861: type(X) when is_reference(X) -> {reference, node(X)};
  862: type(X) when is_port(X) -> {port, node(X)};
  863: type(X) when is_binary(X) -> binary;
  864: type(X) when is_atom(X) -> atom;
  865: type(_) -> unknown.
  866: 
  867: 
  868: mem_larger_than(no_fix_alloc) ->
  869:     true;
  870: mem_larger_than(Mem) ->
  871:     mem() > Mem.
  872: 
  873: mem() ->
  874:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, timer_cancellations),
  875:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations),
  876:     case mem_get() of
  877:         {-1, -1} -> no_fix_alloc;
  878:         {A, U} -> io:format("mem = ~p ~p~n", [A, U]), U
  879:     end.
  880: 
  881: mem_get() ->
  882:     % Bif timer memory
  883:     Ref = make_ref(),
  884:     erlang:system_info({memory_internal, Ref, [fix_alloc]}),
  885:     mem_recv(erts_internal:no_aux_work_threads()-1, Ref, {0, 0}).
  886: 
  887: mem_recv(0, _Ref, AU) ->
  888:     AU;
  889: mem_recv(N, Ref, AU) ->
  890:     receive
  891:         {Ref, _, IL} ->
  892:             mem_recv(N-1, Ref, mem_parse_ilists(IL, AU))
  893:     end.
  894: 
  895: 
  896: mem_parse_ilists([], AU) ->
  897:     AU;
  898: mem_parse_ilists([I|Is], AU) ->
  899:     mem_parse_ilists(Is, mem_parse_ilist(I, AU)).
  900: 
  901: mem_parse_ilist({fix_alloc, false}, _) ->
  902:     {-1, -1};
  903: mem_parse_ilist({fix_alloc, _, IDL}, {A, U}) ->
  904:     case lists:keyfind(fix_types, 1, IDL) of
  905:         {fix_types, TL} ->
  906:             {ThisA, ThisU} = mem_get_btm_aus(TL, 0, 0),
  907:             {ThisA + A, ThisU + U};
  908:         {fix_types, Mask, TL} ->
  909:             {ThisA, ThisU} = mem_get_btm_aus(TL, 0, 0),
  910:             {(ThisA + A) band Mask , (ThisU + U) band Mask}
  911:     end.
  912: 
  913: mem_get_btm_aus([], A, U) ->
  914:     {A, U};
  915: mem_get_btm_aus([{BtmType, BtmA, BtmU} | Types],
  916:                 A, U) when BtmType == bif_timer;
  917:                            BtmType == accessor_bif_timer ->
  918:     mem_get_btm_aus(Types, BtmA+A, BtmU+U);
  919: mem_get_btm_aus([_|Types], A, U) ->
  920:     mem_get_btm_aus(Types, A, U).
